triples.sentence: Iranian keeper [Alireza Beiranvand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alireza_Beiranvand "Alireza Beiranvand") was removed from the game for a suspected [concussion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Concussion "Concussion") before England scored three first-half goals.[[151]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-EngIrn-156)
triples.statement: Iran's goalkeeper, Alireza Beiranvand, was substituted due to a suspected concussion before England scored three goals in the first half.

triples.sentence: [Mehdi Taremi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mehdi_Taremi "Mehdi Taremi") scored in the second half after which England defender [Harry Maguire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Maguire "Harry Maguire") was also removed for a concussion.[[151]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-EngIrn-156)
triples.statement: After Mehdi Taremi scored in the second half, England's defender Harry Maguire was also substituted due to a concussion.

triples.sentence: Substitute [Rouzbeh Cheshmi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rouzbeh_Cheshmi "Rouzbeh Cheshmi") scored the first goal eight minutes into stoppage time, followed by [Ramin Rezaeian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramin_Rezaeian "Ramin Rezaeian") scoring three minutes later.[[153]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-158)
triples.statement: In the Iran vs. Wales match, substitute Rouzbeh Cheshmi scored in the eighth minute of stoppage time, and Ramin Rezaeian scored three minutes later.

triples.sentence: England and the United States played to a 0–0 draw, with only four shots on target between them, and one shot from Christian Pulisic hit the crossbar.[[154]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-159)
triples.statement: The match between England and the United States ended in a 0–0 draw, featuring only four total shots on target and a shot by Christian Pulisic that hit the crossbar.

triples.sentence: England won the group following a 3–0 win over Wales with a goal by [Phil Foden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phil_Foden "Phil Foden") and two by [Marcus Rashford](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcus_Rashford "Marcus Rashford").[[155]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-160)
triples.statement: England secured the top spot in the group by defeating Wales 3–0, with one goal from Phil Foden and two from Marcus Rashford.

triples.sentence: With the United States needing no less than a win to advance, [Christian Pulisic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_Pulisic "Christian Pulisic") scored the winning goal while colliding with the opposing goalkeeper as the United States defeated Iran 1–0 to qualify for the round of 16.[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-161)
triples.statement: The United States defeated Iran 1–0 to qualify for the round of 16, with Christian Pulisic scoring the winning goal.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group C](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_C "2022 FIFA World Cup Group C")

Argentina took an early lead against Saudi Arabia after [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") scored a penalty kick after ten minutes; however, second-half goals by [Saleh Al-Shehri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saleh_Al-Shehri "Saleh Al-Shehri") and [Salem Al-Dawsari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salem_Al-Dawsari "Salem Al-Dawsari") won the match 2–1 for Saudi Arabia,[[157]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-162) a result the media considered one of the biggest upsets in the history of the event.[[158]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-163)[[159]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-164) The match between Mexico and Poland ended as a goalless 0–0 draw after [Guillermo Ochoa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guillermo_Ochoa "Guillermo Ochoa") saved [Robert Lewandowski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Lewandowski "Robert Lewandowski")'s penalty kick attempt.[[160]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-165) Lewandowski scored his first career World Cup goal in a 2–0 win over Saudi Arabia four days later.[[161]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-166)[[162]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-167) Argentina defeated Mexico 2–0, with Messi scoring the opener and later assisting teammate [Enzo Fernández](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enzo_Fern%C3%A1ndez "Enzo Fernández") who scored his first international goal.[[163]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-168)[[164]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-169) Argentina won their last game against Poland with goals from [Alexis Mac Allister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Mac_Allister "Alexis Mac Allister") and [Julián Álvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez "Julián Álvarez"), which was enough to win the group;[[165]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-170) Poland qualified for the knockout stage on goal difference, thanks to Saudi Arabia scoring an injury-time consolation goal against Mexico in a match already lost.[[166]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-171)

[![Image 250](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_24%2C_Argentina_v_Mexico_-_04.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_24%2C_Argentina_v_Mexico_-_04.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_24,_Argentina_v_Mexico_-_04.jpg)

triples.sentence: Argentina took an early lead against Saudi Arabia after [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") scored a penalty kick after ten minutes; however, second-half goals by [Saleh Al-Shehri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saleh_Al-Shehri "Saleh Al-Shehri") and [Salem Al-Dawsari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salem_Al-Dawsari "Salem Al-Dawsari") won the match 2–1 for Saudi Arabia,[[157]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-162) a result the media considered one of the biggest upsets in the history of the event.[[158]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-163)[[159]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-164)
triples.statement: Saudi Arabia defeated Argentina 2-1 in what was considered a major upset, with goals from Saleh Al-Shehri and Salem Al-Dawsari overcoming an early penalty by Lionel Messi.

triples.sentence: The match between Mexico and Poland ended as a goalless 0–0 draw after [Guillermo Ochoa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guillermo_Ochoa "Guillermo Ochoa") saved [Robert Lewandowski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Lewandowski "Robert Lewandowski")'s penalty kick attempt.[[160]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-165)
triples.statement: The match between Mexico and Poland ended in a 0-0 draw after Guillermo Ochoa saved a penalty from Robert Lewandowski.

triples.sentence: Lewandowski scored his first career World Cup goal in a 2–0 win over Saudi Arabia four days later.[[161]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-166)[[162]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-167)
triples.statement: Robert Lewandowski scored his first career World Cup goal in Poland's 2-0 victory over Saudi Arabia.

triples.sentence: Argentina defeated Mexico 2–0, with Messi scoring the opener and later assisting teammate [Enzo Fernández](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enzo_Fern%C3%A1ndez "Enzo Fernández") who scored his first international goal.[[163]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-168)[[164]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-169)
triples.statement: Argentina defeated Mexico 2-0, with Lionel Messi scoring the first goal and assisting Enzo Fernández for his first international goal.

triples.sentence: Argentina won their last game against Poland with goals from [Alexis Mac Allister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Mac_Allister "Alexis Mac Allister") and [Julián Álvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez "Julián Álvarez"), which was enough to win the group;[[165]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-170) Poland qualified for the knockout stage on goal difference, thanks to Saudi Arabia scoring an injury-time consolation goal against Mexico in a match already lost.[[166]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-171)
triples.statement: Argentina won the group by defeating Poland with goals from Alexis Mac Allister and Julián Álvarez; Poland also advanced to the knockout stage on goal difference, aided by a late goal Saudi Arabia scored against Mexico.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group D](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_D "2022 FIFA World Cup Group D")

The match between Denmark and Tunisia ended as a goalless draw; both teams had goals disallowed by offside calls.[[167]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-SKYDenTun-172) Danish midfielder [Christian Eriksen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_Eriksen "Christian Eriksen") made his first major international appearance since suffering a cardiac arrest at the [UEFA Euro 2020](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2020 "UEFA Euro 2020").[[167]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-SKYDenTun-172) Defending champions France went a goal behind to Australia, after a [Craig Goodwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Goodwin "Craig Goodwin") goal within ten minutes. France, however, scored four goals, by [Adrien Rabiot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adrien_Rabiot "Adrien Rabiot"), [Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") and two by [Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud") to win 4–1.[[168]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-GuardianFraAus-173) The goals tied Giroud with [Thierry Henry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thierry_Henry "Thierry Henry") as France's all-time top goalscorer.[[168]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-GuardianFraAus-173)[Mitchell Duke](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitchell_Duke "Mitchell Duke") scored the only goal as Australia won against Tunisia. This was their first World Cup win since 2010.[[169]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto4-174)[[170]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-175) Mbappé scored a brace as France defeated Denmark 2–1. This was enough for France to qualify for the knockout round—the first time since Brazil in 2006 that the defending champions progressed through the opening round.[[169]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto4-174)[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-176)[Mathew Leckie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mathew_Leckie "Mathew Leckie") scored the only goal as Australia defeated Denmark 1–0, qualifying for the knockout round as runners-up with the win.[[172]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-177)[Wahbi Khazri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wahbi_Khazri "Wahbi Khazri") scored for Tunisia against France in the 58th minute. Although [Antoine Griezmann](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antoine_Griezmann "Antoine Griezmann") equalised in stoppage time it was overturned for offside. Tunisia finished third in the group, as they required a draw in the Denmark and Australia game.[[173]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-178)

[![Image 279](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%2811%29.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%2811%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_(11).jpg)

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group E](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_E "2022 FIFA World Cup Group E")

Group E began with Japan facing [2014 champions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup "2014 FIFA World Cup") Germany. After an early penalty kick was converted by Germany's [İlkay Gündoğan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C4%B0lkay_G%C3%BCndo%C4%9Fan "İlkay Gündoğan"), Japan scored two second-half goals by [Ritsu Dōan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ritsu_D%C5%8Dan "Ritsu Dōan") and [Takuma Asano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takuma_Asano "Takuma Asano") in a 2–1 win.[[174]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-179) In the second group match, Spain defeated Costa Rica 7–0. First-half goals by [Dani Olmo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dani_Olmo "Dani Olmo"), [Marco Asensio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marco_Asensio "Marco Asensio"), and [Ferran Torres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferran_Torres "Ferran Torres") were followed by goals by [Gavi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gavi_(footballer) "Gavi (footballer)"), [Carlos Soler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Soler_(footballer) "Carlos Soler (footballer)"), [Alvaro Morata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alvaro_Morata "Alvaro Morata"), and a second by Torres.[[175]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-180)[[176]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-181) This was the largest defeat in a World Cup since Portugal's victory over North Korea in the [2010 event](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup "2010 FIFA World Cup") by the same scoreline.[[177]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-182) Costa Rica defeated Japan 1–0, with [Keysher Fuller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keysher_Fuller "Keysher Fuller") scoring with Costa Rica's first shot on target of the tournament.[[178]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-183) Germany and Spain drew 1–1, with [Álvaro Morata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%81lvaro_Morata "Álvaro Morata") scoring for Spain and [Niclas Füllkrug](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niclas_F%C3%BCllkrug "Niclas Füllkrug") scoring for Germany.[[179]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-184)[[180]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-185)[[181]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-186) Morata scored the opening goal for Spain against Japan as they controlled the first half of the match.[[182]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-:10-187) Japan equalised on [Ritsu Doan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ritsu_Doan "Ritsu Doan") before a second goal by [Ao Tanaka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ao_Tanaka "Ao Tanaka") was heavily investigated by VAR for the ball potentially being out of play.[[183]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-Bunshun.jp_interview_Josek-188) The goal was awarded, and Japan won the group following a 2–1 win. Disputes over the VAR's call was only settled when the [Associated Press](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Associated_Press "Associated Press") released an iconic [bird's eye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bird%27s_eye_view "Bird's eye view") photo of the ball after the match.[[183]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-Bunshun.jp_interview_Josek-188)[Serge Gnabry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serge_Gnabry "Serge Gnabry") scored on ten minutes for Germany against Costa Rica and they led until half-time. Germany required a win, and for Japan to not win their match, or for both teams to win their matches by a combined goal difference of at least 9 goals, to qualify. In the second half, goals by [Yeltsin Tejeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yeltsin_Tejeda "Yeltsin Tejeda") and [Juan Vargas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Pablo_Vargas "Juan Pablo Vargas") gave Costa Rica a 2–1 lead, which would have qualified them into the knockout stages ahead of Spain. Germany scored three further goals—two by [Kai Havertz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kai_Havertz "Kai Havertz") and a goal by [Niclas Fullkrug](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niclas_Fullkrug "Niclas Fullkrug"), ending in a 4–2 win for Germany—which was not enough to qualify them for the final stages. This was the second time in a row that the four-time champions failed to progress past the group stages.[[184]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-189) Japan won the group ahead of Spain.[[185]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-190)

triples.sentence: After an early penalty kick was converted by Germany's [İlkay Gündoğan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C4%B0lkay_G%C3%BCndo%C4%9Fan "İlkay Gündoğan"), Japan scored two second-half goals by [Ritsu Dōan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ritsu_D%C5%8Dan "Ritsu Dōan") and [Takuma Asano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takuma_Asano "Takuma Asano") in a 2–1 win.[[174]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-179)
triples.statement: Japan defeated Germany 2–1, with Ritsu Dōan and Takuma Asano scoring in the second half after an early penalty by Germany's İlkay Gündoğan.

triples.sentence: First-half goals by [Dani Olmo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dani_Olmo "Dani Olmo"), [Marco Asensio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marco_Asensio "Marco Asensio"), and [Ferran Torres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferran_Torres "Ferran Torres") were followed by goals by [Gavi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gavi_(footballer) "Gavi (footballer)"), [Carlos Soler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Soler_(footballer) "Carlos Soler (footballer)"), [Alvaro Morata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alvaro_Morata "Alvaro Morata"), and a second by Torres.[[175]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-180)[[176]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-181)
triples.statement: Spain's goals against Costa Rica were scored by Dani Olmo, Marco Asensio, Ferran Torres (who scored twice), Gavi, Carlos Soler, and Alvaro Morata.

triples.sentence: This was the largest defeat in a World Cup since Portugal's victory over North Korea in the [2010 event](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup "2010 FIFA World Cup") by the same scoreline.[[177]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-182)
triples.statement: This 7-0 defeat was the largest in a World Cup since Portugal beat North Korea by the same score in 2010.

triples.sentence: Costa Rica defeated Japan 1–0, with [Keysher Fuller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keysher_Fuller "Keysher Fuller") scoring with Costa Rica's first shot on target of the tournament.[[178]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-183)
triples.statement: Costa Rica beat Japan 1–0, with Keysher Fuller scoring on Costa Rica's first shot on target in the tournament.

triples.sentence: Germany and Spain drew 1–1, with [Álvaro Morata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%81lvaro_Morata "Álvaro Morata") scoring for Spain and [Niclas Füllkrug](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niclas_F%C3%BCllkrug "Niclas Füllkrug") scoring for Germany.[[179]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-184)[[180]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-185)[[181]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-186)
triples.statement: Germany and Spain played to a 1–1 draw, with goals from Álvaro Morata for Spain and Niclas Füllkrug for Germany.

triples.sentence: Morata scored the opening goal for Spain against Japan as they controlled the first half of the match.[[182]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-:10-187)
triples.statement: Álvaro Morata scored the first goal for Spain against Japan, with Spain controlling the first half.

triples.sentence: This was the second time in a row that the four-time champions failed to progress past the group stages.[[184]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-189)
triples.statement: This marked the second consecutive World Cup where four-time champions Germany did not advance beyond the group stage.

triples.sentence: Japan won the group ahead of Spain.[[185]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-190)
triples.statement: Japan finished first in the group, ahead of Spain.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group F](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_F "2022 FIFA World Cup Group F")

Group F's first match was a goalless draw between Morocco and Croatia.[[186]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-191) Canada had a penalty kick in the first half of their match against Belgium which was saved by [Thibaut Courtois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois "Thibaut Courtois"). Belgium won the match by a single goal by [Michy Batshuayi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michy_Batshuayi "Michy Batshuayi").[[187]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-192)[[188]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-193) Belgium lost 2–0 to Morocco, despite Morocco having a long-range [direct free kick goal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_kick_(association_football) "Free kick (association football)") by [Hakim Ziyech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hakim_Ziyech "Hakim Ziyech") overturned for an offside on another player in the lead up to the goal. Two second-half goals from [Zakaria Aboukhlal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zakaria_Aboukhlal "Zakaria Aboukhlal") and [Romain Saïss](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romain_Sa%C3%AFss "Romain Saïss") helped the Morocco win their first World Cup match since 1998.[[189]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-194)[[190]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-195) The match sparked riots in Belgium, with fires and fireworks being set off by residents.[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-196)[Alphonso Davies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alphonso_Davies "Alphonso Davies") scored Canada's first World Cup goal to give Canada the lead over Croatia. Goals by [Marko Livaja](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marko_Livaja "Marko Livaja"), [Lovro Majer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lovro_Majer "Lovro Majer"), and two by [Andrej Kramarić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrej_Kramari%C4%87 "Andrej Kramarić") for Croatia completed a 4–1 victory.[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-197) Morocco scored two early goals through [Hakim Ziyech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hakim_Ziyech "Hakim Ziyech") and [Youssef En-Nesyri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Youssef_En-Nesyri "Youssef En-Nesyri") in their game against Canada and qualified following a 2–1 victory. Canada's only goal was an [own goal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Own_goal "Own goal") by [Nayef Aguerd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nayef_Aguerd "Nayef Aguerd").[[193]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-198) Croatia and Belgium played a goalless draw which eliminated Belgium, whose team was ranked second in the world, from the tournament.[[194]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-199)

[![Image 342](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c1/Kevin_De_Bruyne_WC2022.jpg/250px-Kevin_De_Bruyne_WC2022.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kevin_De_Bruyne_WC2022.jpg)

triples.sentence: Group F's first match was a goalless draw between Morocco and Croatia.[[186]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-191)
triples.statement: The first match in Group F between Morocco and Croatia ended in a goalless draw.

triples.sentence: Two second-half goals from [Zakaria Aboukhlal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zakaria_Aboukhlal "Zakaria Aboukhlal") and [Romain Saïss](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romain_Sa%C3%AFss "Romain Saïss") helped the Morocco win their first World Cup match since 1998.[[189]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-194)[[190]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-195)
triples.statement: Second-half goals from Zakaria Aboukhlal and Romain Saïss secured Morocco's first World Cup match victory since 1998.

triples.sentence: The match sparked riots in Belgium, with fires and fireworks being set off by residents.[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-196)
triples.statement: The match between Belgium and Morocco sparked riots in Belgium, involving fires and fireworks.

triples.sentence: Goals by [Marko Livaja](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marko_Livaja "Marko Livaja"), [Lovro Majer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lovro_Majer "Lovro Majer"), and two by [Andrej Kramarić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrej_Kramari%C4%87 "Andrej Kramarić") for Croatia completed a 4–1 victory.[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-197)
triples.statement: Croatia defeated Canada 4–1 with goals from Marko Livaja, Lovro Majer, and two from Andrej Kramarić.

triples.sentence: Canada's only goal was an [own goal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Own_goal "Own goal") by [Nayef Aguerd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nayef_Aguerd "Nayef Aguerd").[[193]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-198)
triples.statement: Canada's goal in their match against Morocco was an own goal by Nayef Aguerd.

triples.sentence: Croatia and Belgium played a goalless draw which eliminated Belgium, whose team was ranked second in the world, from the tournament.[[194]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-199)
triples.statement: A goalless draw between Croatia and Belgium resulted in the elimination of Belgium, the world's second-ranked team, from the tournament.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group G](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_G "2022 FIFA World Cup Group G")

[Breel Embolo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breel_Embolo "Breel Embolo") scored the only goal in Switzerland's 1–0 defeat of Cameroon.[[195]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-200)[Richarlison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison") scored two goals as Brazil won against Serbia, with star player [Neymar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar "Neymar") receiving an ankle injury.[[196]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-201) Cameroon's [Jean-Charles Castelletto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Charles_Castelletto "Jean-Charles Castelletto") scored the opening goal against Serbia, but they were quickly behind as Serbia scored three goals by [Strahinja Pavlović](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strahinja_Pavlovi%C4%87 "Strahinja Pavlović"), [Sergej Milinković-Savić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergej_Milinkovi%C4%87-Savi%C4%87 "Sergej Milinković-Savić"), and [Aleksandar Mitrović](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleksandar_Mitrovi%C4%87 "Aleksandar Mitrović") either side of half time. Cameroon, however, scored goals through [Vincent Aboubakar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_Aboubakar "Vincent Aboubakar") and [Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Maxim_Choupo-Moting "Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting"), completing a 3–3 draw.[[197]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-202) An 83rd-minute winner by [Casemiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casemiro "Casemiro") for Brazil over Switzerland was enough for them to qualify for the knockout stage.[[198]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-203) Having already qualified, Brazil were unable to win their final group game, as they were defeated by Cameroon 1–0 following a goal by [Vincent Aboubakar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_Aboubakar "Vincent Aboubakar"). Already having a [yellow card](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yellow_card_(soccer) "Yellow card (soccer)"), he was later sent off for removing his shirt in celebrating the goal.[[199]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-204) Cameroon, however, did not qualify, as Switzerland defeated Serbia 3–2.[[200]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-205)

[![Image 369](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5d/Brasil_vs_Serbia_WC2022.jpg/250px-Brasil_vs_Serbia_WC2022.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Brasil_vs_Serbia_WC2022.jpg)

Brazil v Serbia

triples.sentence: [Breel Embolo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breel_Embolo "Breel Embolo") scored the only goal in Switzerland's 1–0 defeat of Cameroon.[[195]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-200)
triples.statement: Breel Embolo scored the only goal in Switzerland's 1–0 victory over Cameroon.

triples.sentence: [Richarlison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison") scored two goals as Brazil won against Serbia, with star player [Neymar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar "Neymar") receiving an ankle injury.[[196]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-201)
triples.statement: Richarlison scored two goals in Brazil's victory over Serbia, during which Neymar sustained an ankle injury.

triples.sentence: Cameroon, however, scored goals through [Vincent Aboubakar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_Aboubakar "Vincent Aboubakar") and [Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Maxim_Choupo-Moting "Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting"), completing a 3–3 draw.[[197]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-202)
triples.statement: Cameroon later scored goals via Vincent Aboubakar and Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting, resulting in a 3–3 draw with Serbia.

triples.sentence: An 83rd-minute winner by [Casemiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casemiro "Casemiro") for Brazil over Switzerland was enough for them to qualify for the knockout stage.[[198]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-203)
triples.statement: A goal by Casemiro in the 83rd minute secured Brazil's victory over Switzerland and their qualification for the knockout stage.

triples.sentence: Already having a [yellow card](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yellow_card_(soccer) "Yellow card (soccer)"), he was later sent off for removing his shirt in celebrating the goal.[[199]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-204)
triples.statement: Vincent Aboubakar, who already had a yellow card, was sent off after receiving a second one for removing his shirt while celebrating his goal.

triples.sentence: Cameroon, however, did not qualify, as Switzerland defeated Serbia 3–2.[[200]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-205)
triples.statement: Despite their win, Cameroon did not qualify for the next stage because Switzerland beat Serbia 3–2.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup Group H](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_H "2022 FIFA World Cup Group H")

Uruguay and South Korea played to a goalless draw.[[201]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-206) A goalless first half between Portugal and Ghana preceded a penalty converted by [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo "Cristiano Ronaldo") to give Portugal the lead. In scoring the goal, Ronaldo became the first man to score in five World Cups. Ghana responded with a goal by [André Ayew](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9_Ayew "André Ayew") before goals by [João Félix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jo%C3%A3o_F%C3%A9lix "João Félix"), and [Rafael Leão](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Le%C3%A3o "Rafael Leão") by Portugal put them 3–1 ahead. [Osman Bukari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osman_Bukari "Osman Bukari") scored in the 89th minute to trail by a single goal, while [Iñaki Williams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I%C3%B1aki_Williams "Iñaki Williams") had a chance to equalise for Ghana ten minutes into stoppage time, but slipped before shooting. The match finished 3–2 to Portugal.[[202]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-207) Ghanaian [Mohammed Salisu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammed_Salisu "Mohammed Salisu") opened the scoring against South Korea, with [Mohammed Kudus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammed_Kudus "Mohammed Kudus") following it up. In the second half, [Cho Gue-sung](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cho_Gue-sung "Cho Gue-sung") scored a brace for South Korea, levelling the score. Mohammed Kudus scored again in the 68th minute, winning the match 3–2 for Ghana.[[203]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-208) Portugal defeated Uruguay 2–0 with two goals from [Bruno Fernandes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Fernandes "Bruno Fernandes"), advancing them to the knockout stage.[[204]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-209) A controversial penalty decision was called late in the game, with a suspected handball from [José María Giménez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mar%C3%ADa_Gim%C3%A9nez "José María Giménez").[[205]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-210)[[206]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-211) Portugal led South Korea through [Ricardo Horta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricardo_Horta "Ricardo Horta") after 10 minutes. However, goals by [Kim Young-gwon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Young-gwon "Kim Young-gwon") and [Hwang Hee-chan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hwang_Hee-chan "Hwang Hee-chan") won the match 2–1 for South Korea.[[207]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-212)[Giorgian de Arrascaeta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giorgian_de_Arrascaeta "Giorgian de Arrascaeta") scored two goals as Uruguay defeated Ghana 2–0.[[208]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-213) However, with South Korea winning, Uruguay required another goal to progress as they finished third on goals scored.[[209]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-214) Several Uruguay players left the pitch after the game surrounding the referees and followed them off the pitch.[[210]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-215)[[211]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-216)[[212]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-217)

[![Image 401](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_32%2C_Portugal_v_Uruguay_-_02.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_32%2C_Portugal_v_Uruguay_-_02.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Match_32,_Portugal_v_Uruguay_-_02.jpg)

triples.sentence: Uruguay and South Korea played to a goalless draw.[[201]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-206)
triples.statement: Uruguay and South Korea's match ended in a 0-0 draw.

triples.sentence: The match finished 3–2 to Portugal.[[202]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-207)
triples.statement: The match between Portugal and Ghana ended with a 3–2 victory for Portugal.

triples.sentence: Mohammed Kudus scored again in the 68th minute, winning the match 3–2 for Ghana.[[203]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-208)
triples.statement: Mohammed Kudus scored again in the 68th minute, securing a 3–2 win for Ghana.

triples.sentence: Portugal defeated Uruguay 2–0 with two goals from [Bruno Fernandes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Fernandes "Bruno Fernandes"), advancing them to the knockout stage.[[204]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-209)
triples.statement: Portugal beat Uruguay 2–0 with two goals from Bruno Fernandes, which secured their advancement to the knockout stage.

triples.sentence: A controversial penalty decision was called late in the game, with a suspected handball from [José María Giménez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mar%C3%ADa_Gim%C3%A9nez "José María Giménez").[[205]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-210)[[206]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-211)
triples.statement: Late in the game, a controversial penalty was awarded for a suspected handball by José María Giménez.

triples.sentence: However, goals by [Kim Young-gwon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Young-gwon "Kim Young-gwon") and [Hwang Hee-chan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hwang_Hee-chan "Hwang Hee-chan") won the match 2–1 for South Korea.[[207]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-212)
triples.statement: Goals from Kim Young-gwon and Hwang Hee-chan resulted in a 2–1 victory for South Korea.

triples.sentence: [Giorgian de Arrascaeta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giorgian_de_Arrascaeta "Giorgian de Arrascaeta") scored two goals as Uruguay defeated Ghana 2–0.[[208]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-213)
triples.statement: Giorgian de Arrascaeta scored twice in Uruguay's 2–0 victory over Ghana.

triples.sentence: However, with South Korea winning, Uruguay required another goal to progress as they finished third on goals scored.[[209]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-214)
triples.statement: Despite their win, Uruguay was eliminated, finishing third based on goals scored, because South Korea also won their match.

triples.sentence: Several Uruguay players left the pitch after the game surrounding the referees and followed them off the pitch.[[210]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-215)[[211]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-216)[[212]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-217)
triples.statement: After the game, several Uruguayan players surrounded the referees and followed them off the pitch.

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage "2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage")

In the knockout stage, if the scores were equal when normal playing time expired, [extra time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overtime_(Association_football) "Overtime (Association football)") was played for two periods of 15 minutes each. This was followed, if required, by a [penalty shoot-out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)") to determine the winners.[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-regulations-143)

All times are local, [AST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabia_Standard_Time "Arabia Standard Time") ([UTC+3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTC%2B03:00 "UTC+03:00")).

triples.sentence: This was followed, if required, by a [penalty shoot-out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)") to determine the winners.[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-regulations-143)
triples.statement: If the score was still tied after extra time, a penalty shoot-out was used to determine the winner.

section_body:
The round of 16 was played from 3 to 7 December,[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35) which for the first time ever included teams from [the Americas and four other continents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continent#Number "Continent").[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-218) Group A winners Netherlands scored goals through [Memphis Depay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memphis_Depay "Memphis Depay"), [Daley Blind](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daley_Blind "Daley Blind"), and [Denzel Dumfries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denzel_Dumfries "Denzel Dumfries") as they defeated the United States 3–1, with [Haji Wright](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haji_Wright "Haji Wright") scoring for the United States.[[214]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-219) Messi scored his third of the tournament alongside [Julián Álvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez_(footballer) "Julián Álvarez (footballer)") to give Argentina a two-goal lead over Australia, and despite an Enzo Fernández own goal from a [Craig Goodwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Goodwin "Craig Goodwin") shot, Argentina won 2–1.[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-220)[Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud")'s goal and Mbappé's brace enabled France to have a 3–1 victory over Poland, with [Robert Lewandowski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Lewandowski "Robert Lewandowski") scoring the lone goal for Poland from a penalty.[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-221) England beat Senegal 3–0, with goals coming from [Jordan Henderson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jordan_Henderson "Jordan Henderson"), [Harry Kane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Kane "Harry Kane"), and [Bukayo Saka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bukayo_Saka "Bukayo Saka").[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-222)[Daizen Maeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daizen_Maeda "Daizen Maeda") scored for Japan against Croatia in the first half before a leveller from [Ivan Perišić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_Peri%C5%A1i%C4%87 "Ivan Perišić") in the second. Neither team could find the winner, with Croatia defeating Japan 3–1 in a [penalty shoot-out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)").[[218]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-223)[Vinícius Júnior](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vin%C3%ADcius_J%C3%BAnior "Vinícius Júnior"), [Neymar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar "Neymar"), [Richarlison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison"), and [Lucas Paquetá](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucas_Paquet%C3%A1 "Lucas Paquetá") all scored for Brazil, but a volley from South Korean [Paik Seung-ho](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paik_Seung-ho "Paik Seung-ho") reduced the deficit to 4–1.[[219]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-224)[Pablo Sarabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Sarabia "Pablo Sarabia") had the best chance for Spain to break the deadlock against Morocco in stoppage time after two goalless hours, but he hit the goalie's right-hand post after a shot from the left; Morocco won the match 3–0 on penalties.[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-225) A [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick "Hat-trick") by [Gonçalo Ramos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gon%C3%A7alo_Ramos "Gonçalo Ramos") led Portugal to defeat Switzerland 6–1, with goals from Portugal's [Pepe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepe_(footballer,_born_1983) "Pepe (footballer, born 1983)"), [Raphaël Guerreiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapha%C3%ABl_Guerreiro "Raphaël Guerreiro"), and [Rafael Leão](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Le%C3%A3o "Rafael Leão") and from Switzerland's [Manuel Akanji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manuel_Akanji "Manuel Akanji").[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-226)

triples.sentence: Group A winners Netherlands scored goals through [Memphis Depay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memphis_Depay "Memphis Depay"), [Daley Blind](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daley_Blind "Daley Blind"), and [Denzel Dumfries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denzel_Dumfries "Denzel Dumfries") as they defeated the United States 3–1, with [Haji Wright](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haji_Wright "Haji Wright") scoring for the United States.[[214]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-219)
triples.statement: The Netherlands defeated the United States 3–1, with goals from Memphis Depay, Daley Blind, and Denzel Dumfries for the Netherlands, and one from Haji Wright for the United States.

triples.sentence: Messi scored his third of the tournament alongside [Julián Álvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez_(footballer) "Julián Álvarez (footballer)") to give Argentina a two-goal lead over Australia, and despite an Enzo Fernández own goal from a [Craig Goodwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Goodwin "Craig Goodwin") shot, Argentina won 2–1.[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-220)
triples.statement: Argentina won 2–1 against Australia, with goals from Messi and Julián Álvarez, despite an own goal by Enzo Fernández.

triples.sentence: [Daizen Maeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daizen_Maeda "Daizen Maeda") scored for Japan against Croatia in the first half before a leveller from [Ivan Perišić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_Peri%C5%A1i%C4%87 "Ivan Perišić") in the second. Neither team could find the winner, with Croatia defeating Japan 3–1 in a [penalty shoot-out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football) "Penalty shoot-out (association football)").[[218]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-223)
triples.statement: After a 1–1 draw with goals from Daizen Maeda for Japan and Ivan Perišić for Croatia, Croatia defeated Japan 3–1 in a penalty shoot-out.

triples.sentence: [Vinícius Júnior](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vin%C3%ADcius_J%C3%BAnior "Vinícius Júnior"), [Neymar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar "Neymar"), [Richarlison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richarlison "Richarlison"), and [Lucas Paquetá](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucas_Paquet%C3%A1 "Lucas Paquetá") all scored for Brazil, but a volley from South Korean [Paik Seung-ho](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paik_Seung-ho "Paik Seung-ho") reduced the deficit to 4–1.[[219]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-224)
triples.statement: Brazil defeated South Korea 4–1, with goals from Vinícius Júnior, Neymar, Richarlison, and Lucas Paquetá for Brazil, and one from Paik Seung-ho for South Korea.

triples.sentence: [Pablo Sarabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Sarabia "Pablo Sarabia") had the best chance for Spain to break the deadlock against Morocco in stoppage time after two goalless hours, but he hit the goalie's right-hand post after a shot from the left; Morocco won the match 3–0 on penalties.[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-225)
triples.statement: After a 0–0 draw, Morocco defeated Spain 3–0 on penalties.

triples.sentence: A [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick "Hat-trick") by [Gonçalo Ramos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gon%C3%A7alo_Ramos "Gonçalo Ramos") led Portugal to defeat Switzerland 6–1, with goals from Portugal's [Pepe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepe_(footballer,_born_1983) "Pepe (footballer, born 1983)"), [Raphaël Guerreiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapha%C3%ABl_Guerreiro "Raphaël Guerreiro"), and [Rafael Leão](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Le%C3%A3o "Rafael Leão") and from Switzerland's [Manuel Akanji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manuel_Akanji "Manuel Akanji").[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-226)
triples.statement: Portugal defeated Switzerland 6–1, featuring a hat-trick by Gonçalo Ramos, additional goals from Pepe, Raphaël Guerreiro, and Rafael Leão, while Manuel Akanji scored for Switzerland.

section_body:
The quarter-finals were played on 9 and 10 December.[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35) Croatia and Brazil ended 0–0 after 90 minutes and went to extra time. Neymar scored for Brazil in the 15th minute of extra time. Croatia, however, equalised through [Bruno Petković](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Petkovi%C4%87 "Bruno Petković") in the second period of extra time. With the match tied, a penalty shootout decided the contest, with Croatia winning the shootout 4–2.[[222]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-227)[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-228) In the second quarter-final match, [Nahuel Molina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nahuel_Molina "Nahuel Molina") and Messi scored for Argentina before [Wout Weghorst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wout_Weghorst "Wout Weghorst") equalised with two goals shortly before the end of the game. The match went to extra time and then penalties, where Argentina would go on to win 4–3.[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-229) Morocco defeated Portugal 1–0, with [Youssef En-Nesyri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Youssef_En-Nesyri "Youssef En-Nesyri") scoring at the end of the first half. Morocco became the first African and the first Arab nation to advance as far as the semi-finals of the competition.[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-230) Despite [Harry Kane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Kane "Harry Kane") scoring a penalty for England, it was not enough to beat France, who won 2–1 by virtue of goals from [Aurélien Tchouaméni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aur%C3%A9lien_Tchouam%C3%A9ni "Aurélien Tchouaméni") and [Olivier Giroud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud "Olivier Giroud") and a late missed penalty by Kane, sending them to their second consecutive World Cup semi-final and becoming the first defending champions to reach this stage since Brazil in 1998.[[226]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-231)[[227]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-232)

triples.sentence: Morocco became the first African and the first Arab nation to advance as far as the semi-finals of the competition.[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-230)
triples.statement: Morocco became the first African and Arab nation to advance to the semi-finals of the World Cup.

section_body:
The semi-finals were played on 13 and 14 December.[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-schedule-35) Messi scored a penalty kick before [Julián Álvarez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_%C3%81lvarez_(footballer) "Julián Álvarez (footballer)") scored twice to give Argentina a 3–0 victory over Croatia.[[228]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-233)[Théo Hernandez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Th%C3%A9o_Hernandez "Théo Hernandez") scored after five minutes as France led Morocco for most of the game. [Randal Kolo Muani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Randal_Kolo_Muani "Randal Kolo Muani") scored in the 78th minute to complete a 2–0 victory for France over Morocco as they reached their second consecutive final.[[229]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-234)

section_body:
The third place play-off was played on 17 December. The two teams had played against each other in their [opening game in Group F](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_F#Morocco_vs_Croatia "2022 FIFA World Cup Group F") which finished 0–0. [Joško Gvardiol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jo%C5%A1ko_Gvardiol "Joško Gvardiol") promptly scored for Croatia, with [Achraf Dari](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Achraf_Dari "Achraf Dari") equalising just 2 minutes later. [Mislav Oršić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mislav_Or%C5%A1i%C4%87 "Mislav Oršić") scored the winner for Croatia as the match finished 2–1.[[230]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-235) Morocco earned 4th place, a record for the team and the best World Cup finish of any African or Arab nation.[[231]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-236)

section_body:
Main article: [2022 FIFA World Cup final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final "2022 FIFA World Cup final")

The final was played on 18 December between Argentina and France. Both teams had won the event twice previously.[[232]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final1-237) Early goals from Lionel Messi and [Ángel Di María](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%81ngel_Di_Mar%C3%ADa "Ángel Di María") gave Argentina, leading 2–0, a head start against the French.[[232]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final1-237)[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238) Despite substitutions in the first half, France did not record a shot until after the 70th minute but were energised by additional substitutions in the 71st. A few minutes later, France were awarded a penalty as [Randal Kolo Muani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Randal_Kolo_Muani "Randal Kolo Muani") was brought down in the penalty area by [Nicolás Otamendi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Otamendi "Nicolás Otamendi"). Mbappé scored the penalty and added a second goal less than two minutes later to equalise the scores.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238) With the score tied at two goals apiece, the match went to extra time. Messi scored his second goal in the 108th minute, once again giving Argentina the lead. However, Mbappé was awarded a second penalty in the 115th minute after his shot hit the arm of [Gonzalo Montiel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gonzalo_Montiel "Gonzalo Montiel"). Mbappé scored his third goal, becoming the second player ever to complete a [hat-trick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick "Hat-trick") in the final of a World Cup after [Geoff Hurst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geoff_Hurst "Geoff Hurst") for England in [1966](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1966_FIFA_World_Cup "1966 FIFA World Cup").[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238) With the score tied at 3–3, the match was determined via a penalty shootout. Argentina won the final after scoring all of their penalties, winning 4–2.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238) This marked their third World Cup win and their first since [1986](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup "1986 FIFA World Cup"), and also the second team (after [Spain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain_national_football_team "Spain national football team") in [2010](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup "2010 FIFA World Cup")) to win the tournament after having lost their opening game.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-final2-238)

section_body:
Note: Goals scored in penalty shoot-outs are not counted towards players' goal counts or to match goal counts.

[![Image 580](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%287%29_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_%287%29_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2022_FIFA_World_Cup_France_4%E2%80%931_Australia_-_(7)_(cropped).jpg)

France forward [Kylian Mbappé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9 "Kylian Mbappé") won the [Golden Boot award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup Golden Boot") after scoring eight goals in the tournament, the most since [Ronaldo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer) "Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)") in [2002](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2002_FIFA_World_Cup "2002 FIFA World Cup").

There were 172 goals scored in 64 matches, for an average of 2.69 goals per match.

Two own goals were scored throughout the tournament.[[234]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-239)

This was the most goals ever scored at a FIFA World Cup.[[235]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-240)

triples.sentence: Two own goals were scored throughout the tournament.[[234]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-239)
triples.statement: Two own goals were scored during the tournament.

triples.sentence: This was the most goals ever scored at a FIFA World Cup.[[235]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-240)
triples.statement: This was the highest number of goals ever scored in a FIFA World Cup.

section_body:
A player is automatically suspended for the next match for the following offences:[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-regulations-143)

*   Receiving a red card (red card suspensions may be extended for serious offences)
*   Receiving two yellow cards in two matches; yellow cards expire after the completion of the quarter-finals (yellow card suspensions are not carried forward to any other future international matches)

The following suspensions were served during the tournament:

| Player | Offence(s) | Suspension(s) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| [![Image 700: Ecuador](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Flag_of_Ecuador.svg/40px-Flag_of_Ecuador.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador_national_football_team "Ecuador national football team")[Jhegson Méndez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jhegson_M%C3%A9ndez "Jhegson Méndez") | ![Image 701: Yellow card](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b1/Yellow_card.svg/20px-Yellow_card.svg.png) in [Group A](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_A#Qatar_vs_Ecuador "2022 FIFA World Cup Group A") vs [Qatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qatar_national_football_team "Qatar national football team") (matchday 1; 20 November) ![Image 702: Yellow card](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b1/Yellow_card.svg/20px-Yellow_card.svg.png) in [Group A](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_A#Netherlands_vs_Ecuador "2022 FIFA World Cup Group A") vs [Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team "Netherlands national football team") (matchday 2; 25 November) | [Group A](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_A#Ecuador_vs_Senegal "2022 FIFA World Cup Group A") vs [Senegal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senegal_national_football_team "Senegal national football team") (matchday 3; 29 November) [[236]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-241) |

section_body:
[![Image 738](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg/250px-Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel-Messi-Argentina-2022-FIFA-World-Cup.jpg)

Argentina captain and forward [Lionel Messi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi "Lionel Messi") won the [Golden Ball award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball"), becoming the first player to win it twice.

The following [World Cup awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards "FIFA World Cup awards") were given at the conclusion of the tournament: the [Golden Boot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup Golden Boot") (top scorer), [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball") (best overall player) and [Golden Glove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Glove "FIFA World Cup Golden Glove") (best goalkeeper).[[248]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-253)

| [Golden Ball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Ball "FIFA World Cup Golden Ball") | Silver Ball | Bronze Ball |
| --- | --- | --- |

| [Golden Boot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Boot "FIFA World Cup Golden Boot") | Silver Boot | Bronze Boot |
