triples.statement: Security officials at stadiums confiscated rainbow-colored clothing and flags.

triples.sentence: American journalist [Grant Wahl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grant_Wahl "Grant Wahl") was briefly detained for wearing a t-shirt with a rainbow on it.[[426]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-432)
triples.statement: American journalist Grant Wahl was briefly detained for wearing a t-shirt with a rainbow on it.

triples.sentence: They criticised the Qatar Supreme Committee for not providing [defibrillators](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defibrillator "Defibrillator") in the stadium, as they had looked for one to try to help Wahl.[[429]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-435)
triples.statement: The journalists criticized the Qatar Supreme Committee for not providing defibrillators in the stadium when they were trying to help Wahl.

triples.sentence: In response, FIFA said that according to the ambulance service, a defibrillator was made available when paramedics later arrived on scene.[[430]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-436)
triples.statement: In response, FIFA stated that according to the ambulance service, a defibrillator was available when paramedics arrived on the scene.

triples.sentence: An autopsy done on Wahl in [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City "New York City") later revealed that Wahl died from an [aortic aneurysm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aortic_aneurysm "Aortic aneurysm") rupture.[[431]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-437)
triples.statement: An autopsy performed in New York City revealed that Grant Wahl died from a ruptured aortic aneurysm.

triples.sentence: Discrimination against women in Qatar was also criticised.[[432]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-FIFI_World_Cup_Qatar_Controversial_Host-438)[[433]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-439)
triples.statement: Discrimination against women in Qatar was also criticized.

triples.sentence: [Women in Qatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women_in_Qatar "Women in Qatar") have few freedoms,[[432]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-FIFI_World_Cup_Qatar_Controversial_Host-438)[[434]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-440) as they must obtain permission from their male guardians to marry, study abroad on government scholarships, work in many government jobs, travel abroad, receive certain forms of reproductive health care, and act as the primary guardian of children, even if they are divorced.[[435]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-441)
triples.statement: Women in Qatar have few freedoms and must get permission from male guardians to marry, study abroad on government scholarships, work in many government jobs, travel abroad, receive certain reproductive health care, and act as a child's primary guardian, even if divorced.

triples.sentence: The criminal case was eventually dropped months after she was allowed to leave Qatar.[[436]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-442)
triples.statement: The criminal case was dropped months after the woman was permitted to leave Qatar.

section_body:
[![Image 751](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Iran_national_team_fan_01.jpg/250px-Iran_national_team_fan_01.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Iran_national_team_fan_01.jpg)

An Iranian fan showing a banner with "[Woman, Life, Freedom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woman,_Life,_Freedom "Woman, Life, Freedom")" slogan.

In November 2022, there were reports suggesting that the government of [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran "Iran") were working with Qatari officials to suppress anti-government protests at the 2022 FIFA World Cup,[[437]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto7-443) in light of the [Mahsa Amini protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mahsa_Amini_protests "Mahsa Amini protests"). Leaked documents and audio clips suggested that Iranian government officials were in correspondence with Qatari authorities in order to handle possible protesters.[[438]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-444)

In November 2022, the Qatari government revoked the visas of journalists from a London-based Iranian news channel, [Iran International](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran_International "Iran International"), known for being critical of the regime, who were seeking to cover the World Cup.[[439]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-445) On 21 November 2022, during the first group stage match from Group B, between Iran and England, attempts were reportedly made by the stadium's security forces to block Iranian fans who wore clothing or carried items bearing slogans that were deemed unsympathetic to the Islamic government of Iran.[[440]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-446) These included t-shirts and signs with "[Woman, Life, Freedom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woman,_Life,_Freedom "Woman, Life, Freedom")" embedded onto them, Iran's previous flags, or any slogans containing the name of [Mahsa Amini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Mahsa_Amini "Death of Mahsa Amini").[[441]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-447) This crackdown continued throughout all of Iran's matches at the World Cup.[[437]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto7-443) In addition to removing fans from stadiums, reports showed that officials tried to suppress any filming or photography of possible protests. In one case, Qatari police detained Danish TV presenter, Rasmus Tantholdt, for filming fans with "Woman, Life, Freedom" slogans, some of whom who had been earlier abused by a group of pro-government supporters.[[442]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-448)

triples.sentence: In November 2022, there were reports suggesting that the government of [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran "Iran") were working with Qatari officials to suppress anti-government protests at the 2022 FIFA World Cup,[[437]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-auto7-443) in light of the [Mahsa Amini protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mahsa_Amini_protests "Mahsa Amini protests").
triples.statement: In November 2022, reports suggested the Iranian government was collaborating with Qatari officials to suppress anti-government protests at the World Cup, in light of the Mahsa Amini protests.

triples.statement: Leaked documents and audio clips suggested that Iranian government officials corresponded with Qatari authorities to manage potential protesters.

section_path: Treatment of Jewish and Israeli visitors
section_body:
Qatar had previously promised to provide Jewish tourists with cooked [_kosher_ food](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kashrut "Kashrut") and public [Jewish prayer services](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prayer_in_Judaism "Prayer in Judaism") at the tournament. However, shortly before the World Cup began, both were banned by Qatar, who claimed it could not secure the safety of Jews.[[443]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-449)[[444]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-450) Qatar alleged that they could not "secure" the safety of publicly praying Jewish tourists, whilst many foreign Jews complained that they subsequently had no food available to eat. It was estimated that 10,000 [religious Jews from Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_Jews "Israeli Jews") and around the world arrived to watch the World Cup in Qatar.[[445]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-:23-451)

Whilst Jewish organisations complained of being unable to find cooked kosher food,[[445]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-:23-451) the [Israeli government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Israel "Government of Israel") said it was happy with the efforts made by Qatar to meet its requests, including kosher food, direct flights from Israel to Qatar, and temporary diplomatic representation in the country. A kosher kitchen under the supervision of Rabbi [Mendy Chitrik](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mendy_Chitrik "Mendy Chitrik") was open in time for the first match. Rabbi [Marc Schneier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marc_Schneier "Marc Schneier"), president of [The Foundation for Ethnic Understanding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Foundation_for_Ethnic_Understanding "The Foundation for Ethnic Understanding"), said he had never asked the Qatari government for cooked food, and he had been the only person in communication with the Qataris regarding making the World Cup experience inclusive for Jews.[[446]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-452)

Multiple Israeli reporters at the tournament reported fans from [Arab nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab_world "Arab world") waving [Palestinian flags](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Palestine "Flag of Palestine") and chanting [anti-Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Israel "Criticism of Israel") slogans while harassing them.[[310]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-JPost_2022-315)[[447]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-merged1-453)[[448]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-454) Some Israelis reported that they had been escorted out of restaurants when their nationality was revealed.[[449]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-455) The Israeli government warned its citizens traveling to the tournament to hide their Israeli identity out of safety concerns.[[450]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-456)

triples.sentence: However, shortly before the World Cup began, both were banned by Qatar, who claimed it could not secure the safety of Jews.[[443]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-449)[[444]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-450)
triples.statement: Shortly before the World Cup began, Qatar banned both cooked kosher food and public Jewish prayer services, claiming it could not secure the safety of Jews.

triples.sentence: It was estimated that 10,000 [religious Jews from Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_Jews "Israeli Jews") and around the world arrived to watch the World Cup in Qatar.[[445]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-:23-451)
triples.statement: An estimated 10,000 religious Jews from Israel and around the world attended the World Cup in Qatar.

triples.sentence: Whilst Jewish organisations complained of being unable to find cooked kosher food,[[445]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-:23-451) the [Israeli government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Israel "Government of Israel") said it was happy with the efforts made by Qatar to meet its requests, including kosher food, direct flights from Israel to Qatar, and temporary diplomatic representation in the country.
triples.statement: While Jewish organizations complained about being unable to find cooked kosher food, the Israeli government stated it was happy with Qatar's efforts to meet its requests, which included kosher food, direct flights from Israel, and temporary diplomatic representation.

triples.sentence: Multiple Israeli reporters at the tournament reported fans from [Arab nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab_world "Arab world") waving [Palestinian flags](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Palestine "Flag of Palestine") and chanting [anti-Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_Israel "Criticism of Israel") slogans while harassing them.[[310]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-JPost_2022-315)[[447]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-merged1-453)[[448]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-454)
triples.statement: Multiple Israeli reporters at the tournament reported being harassed by fans from Arab nations who were waving Palestinian flags and chanting anti-Israeli slogans.

triples.sentence: Some Israelis reported that they had been escorted out of restaurants when their nationality was revealed.[[449]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-455)
triples.statement: Some Israelis reported being escorted out of restaurants when their nationality was revealed.

triples.sentence: The Israeli government warned its citizens traveling to the tournament to hide their Israeli identity out of safety concerns.[[450]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-456)
triples.statement: The Israeli government warned its citizens traveling to the tournament to hide their Israeli identity due to safety concerns.

section_body: The [Rawdat Al Jahhaniya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rawdat_Al_Jahhaniya "Rawdat Al Jahhaniya") fan village was criticised for its overpriced "night cabins" (£185 per night) made out of shipping containers. Tourists complained that the air conditioners in the cabins did not function well, facilities were falling apart, and the sleeping experience did not match their expectations.[[451]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-457) The BBC reported that the tent accommodation at the Qetaifan Island fan village got criticism for having brown-coloured tap water and no air conditioning other than a standing fan.[[452]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-458)[[453]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-459) The tent village in [Al Khor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Khor "Al Khor") was criticised for having inconvenient transportation, a lack of alcohol, long waits to check in, and no locks on the tents.[[454]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-460)[[455]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-461) The lack of suitable and affordable accommodation raised demand for daily shuttle flights from neighbouring areas, such as Dubai, that had adequate numbers of hotel rooms.[[456]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-462)

triples.sentence: Tourists complained that the air conditioners in the cabins did not function well, facilities were falling apart, and the sleeping experience did not match their expectations.[[451]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-457)
triples.statement: Tourists complained that the air conditioners in the cabins were ineffective, facilities were in disrepair, and the overall sleeping experience was disappointing.

triples.sentence: The lack of suitable and affordable accommodation raised demand for daily shuttle flights from neighbouring areas, such as Dubai, that had adequate numbers of hotel rooms.[[456]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup#cite_note-462)
triples.statement: A shortage of suitable and affordable accommodation increased demand for daily shuttle flights from nearby areas like Dubai, which had sufficient hotel rooms.
